title: Polymer Labs secures $23M to bring IBC to Ethereum - Blockworks
summary:
Polymer Labs, a startup focused on interchain communication, has secured $23 million in funding to bring the Inter-Blockchain Communication (IBC) protocol to the Ethereum network. The funding round was led by Blockchain Capital, Maven 11, and Distributed Global, with participation from Coinbase Ventures, Placeholder, Digital Currency Group, North Island Ventures, and Figment Capital.

Polymer Labs is developing a modular layer-2 network that utilizes the IBC protocol, along with the Cosmos SDK's settlement functionality and Eigenlayer's data availability layer. The company aims to make it easier for blockchain applications to communicate with each other by providing a standardized interoperability solution.

The founders of Polymer Labs, Bo Du and Peter Kim, previously worked on various side projects in the blockchain industry but found it challenging to build interchain products. They decided to focus on fixing blockchain interoperability and discovered the Cosmos SDK's IBC protocol, which they believed was the most decentralized and elegant solution for establishing connections and passing messages between chains.

Polymer

title: Donald Trump Sold $2.4 Million Ethereum: Smart Move Or Big Mistake? - Yahoo Finance
summary: Former US President Donald Trump has sold over 1,000 Ethereum (ETH) worth over $2.4 million through Coinbase, according to blockchain analytics company Arkham Intelligence. The ETH comes from royalties for non-fungible token (NFT) projects that Trump created, including a set of 45,000 NFTs priced at $99 that have amassed trading volumes of over $35 million or 15,000 ETH. While Trump is not directly associated with the project, he is still earning royalties. The sale comes after a strong month for Ethereum, with the price up over 17%, 30%, and 60% in the past year, month, and six months, respectively. Trump has previously expressed skepticism towards Bitcoin and crypto, but the recent sale is an interesting development in his relationship with crypto. As the presidential race heats up, it will be important to watch for news relating to presidential candidates' stances on crypto, as this could have large implications for prices, future adoption, and use cases going

title: Ethereum Layer 2 developer Polymer Labs raises $23 million in Series A funding - The Block
summary: Polymer Labs, a developer of an Ethereum Layer 2 network, has raised $23 million in a Series A funding round. The round was led by Blockchain Capital, Maven 11, and Distributed Global, with participation from Coinbase Ventures, Placeholder, Digital Currency Group, North Island Ventures, and Figment Capital. The funds will be used to expand the current team of 30 members and launch the mainnet sometime this year, depending on the performance of the testnet. Polymer Labs is building an "Ethereum interoperability hub" to connect Ethereum and its rollups, and then all blockchains, with the goal of establishing the next generation of the internet. The company utilizes the Inter-Blockchain Communication (IBC) protocol, the Cosmos standard for blockchain interoperability, and the Optimism Stack for its hub. Any developer building any web3 application on any chain will eventually be able to use its interoperability tool, according to Polymer.

title: Coinbase confronts client diversity risk following Nethermind bug - Blockworks
summary: Coinbase, a leading cryptocurrency exchange, is taking steps to address client diversity concerns on the Ethereum network following a recent outage that affected 8% of Ethereum validators. The outage was caused by a bug in the Nethermind client software, which is used by 84% of Ethereum validators, including Coinbase Cloud, Binance, and Kraken. The bug caused validators to go offline, raising concerns about the centralization of Ethereum and the potential consequences if the most popular execution client, Geth, were to shut down. Coinbase is actively assessing alternative execution clients to promote client diversity and ensure the health of the Ethereum network. The company believes that diversifying clients can help prevent similar incidents and ensure the network's stability and security. Coinbase will share an update on alternative execution client solutions in late February.

title: An Ethereum ETF is coming sooner than you expect - Cointelegraph
summary:
The article discusses the imminent approval of an Ethereum (ETH) spot exchange-traded fund (ETF) by the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). The SEC has already approved a Bitcoin (BTC) spot ETF, and the industry is now focused on the approval of an ETH spot ETF. The article notes that the SEC's denial of previous ETH ETF applications was based on prejudice against Bitcoin, but with the approval of the BTC spot ETF, the regulatory body is now required to approve the ETH ETF.

The article highlights that the SEC has instituted proceedings on VanEck's ETH ETF application, which is the first one with a deadline of May 23, 2024. BlackRock's application has a deadline in August, but the SEC is unlikely to deny the application based on liquidity concerns, as the market appears certain that an approval is coming in May.

The article also notes that the path has been cleared for any kind of crypto-backed or linked ETP,

title: Making Vitalik Buterin's cypherpunk dream for Ethereum a reality - Cointelegraph
summary:
Vitalik Buterin, co-founder of Ethereum, has expressed a desire to make the network more cypherpunk, meaning it should be decentralized, open, and resistant to censorship. However, he has also lamented the rise of "degeneracy" on the network, which he believes is driven by high transaction fees. Buterin argues that when transaction fees are high, only "degen gamblers" are willing to use the network, rather than more legitimate users.

To address this issue, Buterin has highlighted the Ethereum Name Service (ENS) as a unique and successful non-financial use case on the network. ENS allows users to personalize their Ethereum addresses with easily recognizable words or phrases, such as a name or a brand.

Nick Johnson, founder and lead developer of ENS, believes that the cypherpunk idealogy will become increasingly popular with the public as they become more familiar with centralization and its negative associations. He notes that as blockchain technology advances, there are decentralized alternatives for every centralized option.

However, the

title: Ethereum Price Analysis: ETH Retreats Lower From $2,700 - Live Bitcoin News
summary: The Ethereum price has been declining since reaching a high of $2,718, with the price now trading at $2,450. The 4-hour chart shows that the ETH price is below the $2,550 support zone and the 55 simple moving average. A key bearish trend line is forming with support at $2,400, and the price could start a fresh increase if it clears the $2,400 resistance zone. However, if the price breaks the $2,300 support zone, it could decline to $2,120 or even $2,075. Technical indicators such as the MACD and RSI are gaining momentum in the bearish zone. Key support levels are at $2,300 and $2,200, while key resistance levels are at $2,380, $2,400, and $2,440.

title: Ethereum Price Plunge Continues! ETH Price On The Path To Retest $2,000 This Week? - Coinpedia Fintech News
summary: The article discusses the current price trend of Ethereum (ETH) and its potential future movements. According to expert analyst Elena, the ETH price is on a downward trajectory and may retest its support level of $2,102 in the near future. The article highlights the technical indicators on TradingView, which suggest a bearish influence in the market, including a red histogram on the MACD and a bearish curve on the averages. If the market continues to lose value, ETH may test its lower support level of $2,000 this month. However, if the market experiences a trend reversal, the ETH price may attempt to test its resistance level of $2,248 and potentially reach its upper resistance level of $2,401 in the coming days.

title: Ethereum Interoperability Hub Polymer Raises $23M Series A Funding From Marquee Investors - CoinDesk
summary: Polymer Labs, a startup focused on Ethereum interoperability, has raised $23 million in Series A funding from prominent investors to address the issue of unreliable and vulnerable interoperability solutions in the Ethereum ecosystem. According to Polymer Labs, existing interoperability solutions such as token bridges have proven susceptible to hacks, leading to a lack of standardization and billions of dollars lost in exploits. The funding will be used to develop Polymer's interoperability hub, which aims to provide a secure and standardized way for different Ethereum-based projects to communicate and exchange value with each other. The funding round included participation from notable investors such as a16z, Dragonfly Capital, and Paradigm.

title: SEC Commissioner: Ethereum ETF approvals won't be same as Bitcoin - crypto.news
summary:
SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce has expressed that the approval process for Ethereum ETFs will be different from the one for Bitcoin ETFs. She believes that the SEC has learned lessons from the Bitcoin ETF saga and will not repeat the same mistakes. Peirce emphasized that the regulators will make regular consumer and market considerations when evaluating ETH ETF applicants, and they will not need to be persuaded by a court to approve these products.

Peirce also expressed frustration over the long delays in Bitcoin ETF approvals, suggesting that these products met the requirements for approval long ago. She also shed light on the SEC's X account hack, which led to a brief market manipulation, and believes that the hack might have been avoided if the SEC hadn't built up so much attention around these approvals.

In addition, Peirce emphasized that approving spot Bitcoin ETFs does not necessarily mean that the SEC will change how it regulates crypto. She clarified that the agency is not in the business of policing crypto, but rather

title: Ethereum validators' reliance on Geth sparks client diversity push by Coinbase - CryptoSlate
summary: Coinbase, a leading cryptocurrency exchange, has announced plans to diversify its execution clients on the Ethereum network due to concerns over the dominance of the Geth execution client. Geth is used by 84% of Ethereum validators, raising security apprehensions within the community. A recent bug issue with Geth took all Nethermind validators offline, highlighting the potential impact of a similar occurrence on the network. Coinbase is conducting a technical assessment to identify alternative qualified execution clients for its platform and plans to release a formal update by the end of February. The development studio behind MEV Watch, a tool addressing censorship risks on the Ethereum blockchain, has warned that stakers running Geth face the prospect of losing up to 100% of their assets in the event of a critical bug discovery.

title: Polymer Aims to Unify Ethereum Ecosystem With 'Interoperability Hub' - Decrypt
summary:
Polymer, a new entrant in the Ethereum layer-2 solutions space, has announced a $23 million Series A funding round with investments from top VCs in the crypto space. The company aims to build a network that provides interoperability-as-a-service to Ethereum and other Ethereum-based networks, such as Arbitrum and Optimism. Polymer plans to use the Cosmos IBC protocol to create a neutral standard for cross-chain communication, allowing developers to build cross-chain applications without the usual headaches.

Polymer's interoperability hub is designed to unify the fragmented Ethereum ecosystem, which is currently plagued by a lack of standardization and interoperability. By providing a neutral standard for cross-chain communication, Polymer hopes to empower developers to build applications that can communicate with each other seamlessly across different blockchains.

While Polymer faces competition from other layer-2 solutions and interoperability protocols, such as Layer Zero and the Ethereum rollups, the company believes that its focus on neutrality and ease of use will set

title: Ethereum Whale Moves $46 Million in ETH Across Binance, Bitfinex and Aave: Details - U.Today
summary: An Ethereum whale has moved a large sum of $46 million in ETH across various exchanges, including Binance and Bitfinex, and staked it with Lido. The transactions occurred over the past two days and involved the withdrawal of ETH from Aave, a DeFi protocol, and subsequent exchange for stablecoin USDT on a CEX platform. The whale then exchanged the USDT for 19,021 ETH, equivalent to the $46 million value. The timing of these transactions coincided with a challenging period for the Ethereum market, which has seen a 4.57% dip in the last 24 hours and a 9.46% decline in the past week. Additionally, there have been significant liquidations of ETH within the last 24 hours, totaling $53.78 million, with long liquidations accounting for $47.48 million and short liquidations accounting for $6.29 million.

title: Ethereum's record number of hodlers downgrades Bitcoin to second place - Baltic Times
summary: The article discusses how Ethereum has seen a record number of long-term holders, with 72% of Ethereum holders holding the cryptocurrency for over 12 months, compared to 33.6 million long-term holders of Bitcoin. This growth in hodler numbers is attributed to several factors, including the rise in Ethereum staking, the expansion of the Ethereum ecosystem, and the adaptability and innovation of the Ethereum network. The article also notes that while Ethereum may not be able to steal the leader position from Bitcoin in the near future, the growth in long-term holders serves as an indicator of Ethereum's strength and potential.

title: Coinbase addresses Geth dominance concerns with client diversity - Cointelegraph
summary: Coinbase, a leading cryptocurrency exchange, is taking steps to address concerns about the dominance of the Geth execution client in the Ethereum ecosystem. Geth is the only Ethereum execution client that meets Coinbase Cloud's technical requirements, but the exchange is aware of the risks associated with relying on a single client and is working to add another client to its infrastructure. This move comes after an X post highlighted the issue and drew a response from Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong. The exchange is conducting a technical assessment of alternative execution clients and plans to release an update by the end of February. The move towards client diversity is seen as critical to ensure the security and stability of the Ethereum network, with concerns about bugs in execution clients being particularly pertinent after a recent bug in Nethermind's execution client was addressed.

title: Ethereum traders realize nearly $33 million in losses as overheated futures market cools - FXStreet
summary: The article discusses the recent loss of nearly $33 million by Ethereum traders due to the correction in the crypto market on Monday. The ETH funding rate declined alongside Ethereum's price drop of nearly 7%, indicating a cooling-off in the derivatives market. However, sentiment among traders improved, which could lead to a recovery in the altcoin's price. The article also highlights on-chain indicators that suggest Ethereum could begin a recovery, such as a decline in the funding rate and an improvement in weighted sentiment. The article concludes that while Ethereum price could find support at $2,232, a daily candlestick close below this level could invalidate the bullish thesis, and a further drop could lead to a bearish imbalance zone between $2,086 and $2,056.

title: Solana Dominates Ethereum, Bitcoin In NFT, Activity: What’s Next For SOL? - NewsBTC
summary: The article discusses the recent surge in non-fungible token (NFT) activity on the Solana blockchain, with the platform dominating other high-throughput alternatives like Ethereum and Bitcoin. According to on-chain data from SolanaFloor, Solana has the highest numbers in unique wallets, transactions, unique buyers, and first-time wallets over the past week. The article attributes Solana's success to its high throughput and low transaction fees, which make it an attractive option for NFT projects, collectors, and traders. Additionally, the article mentions that Solana developers are working on improving the platform's decentralization and reliability through the activation of Firedancer, a validator client developed by Jump Capital. The article concludes by mentioning that SOL, the native cryptocurrency of Solana, is trading at around $80 and has the potential to recover and retest $125 in the future.

title: Coinbase to address Ethereum client diversity woes - crypto.news
summary: Coinbase, a major cryptocurrency exchange, has announced plans to diversify its Ethereum execution client infrastructure in response to the increasing dominance of Geth (go-ethereum) in the ecosystem. Geth handles transactions and the deployment and execution of smart contracts on the Ethereum network, and its dominance has raised concerns about centralization and the risks associated with a single client. Coinbase will conduct a technical assessment of alternative Ethereum execution clients and is committed to integrating another client into its infrastructure by the end of February 2024. This move underscores a broader issue within the Ethereum network, as approximately 85% of all nodes operate using Geth, which could lead to systemic risks in the event of a major bug.

title: JP Morgan Says Spot Ethereum ETFs Approval Is Next – With 50% Chances - Coinpedia Fintech News
summary: JP Morgan analysts have expressed skepticism about the approval of Spot Ethereum ETFs by the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), estimating the likelihood of approval to be no higher than 50%. The analysts attribute their cautious stance to regulatory and judicial considerations, particularly the SEC's classification of Ethereum as a commodity or a security. The SEC has delayed the decision on Fidelity's Ethereum Spot ETF and is now anticipated between late January and August 2024. Grayscale's application for an Ethereum Spot ETF is also expected to provide more clarity on the possible introduction of these ETFs on January 25. However, the SEC's recent approval of Spot Bitcoin ETFs may signal a positive shift, but Chairman Gary Gensler's public declaration that the agency neither approves nor endorses Bitcoin adds a layer of caution in the crypto community.

title: SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce: No Lawsuit Needed for Spot Ethereum ETF Approvals - Yahoo Finance
summary: SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce has stated that the SEC should not require a lawsuit to approve spot Ethereum (ETH) exchange-traded fund (ETF) applications. Peirce believes that the SEC should learn from the Grayscale court ruling that preceded the approval of spot Bitcoin ETFs in the US, and that the SEC should not need a court to tell it that its approach is "arbitrary and capricious" in order to make the right decisions. She emphasized the importance of ensuring that the disclosures align with how the product actually works. Several companies have submitted spot Ether ETF applications to the SEC, with a 70% chance of approval by May, according to Bloomberg ETF analyst Eric Balchunas. SEC Chair Gary Gensler has previously stated that the approval of a spot Bitcoin ETF does not signal the Commission's willingness to approve listing standards for other cryptocurrency ETF applications, as most crypto assets are investment contracts subject to federal securities laws.

title: Ethereum Software Client Centralization Sparks Concern - The Defiant - DeFi News
summary: The article highlights concerns about the centralization of Ethereum nodes, with 84% of nodes running the Go Ethereum (Geth) client. This concentration of nodes has raised worries that a critical bug in the Geth client could result in the destruction of millions of ETH, as well as the potential for a chain to be unable to finalize, leading to incorrect forks. The article notes that large stakers, such as Lido Finance, Coinbase, Kraken, and Figment, have the resources to easily switch their infrastructure and take action to support the network's health. The article concludes by urging these entities to take action for the good of the network and their end users.

title: Ethereum, Solana Losses Pile Up as Bitcoin Sell-Off Sinks Crypto Market - Decrypt
summary: The article discusses the recent losses in the cryptocurrency market, particularly among top 20 cryptocurrencies such as Ethereum (ETH), Solana (SOL), and Avalanche (AVAX). These coins had been making gains in recent weeks due to institutional investor interest, but have now slipped by at least 14% over the past seven days. ETH is down 7% over the past 24 hours, SOL has fallen 16% over the past week, and AVAX has plunged 19% on the week. Despite these losses, long-term holders of these coins have reason to be optimistic, as they have seen significant gains over the past year. The broader crypto market has taken a nosedive following the price action of Bitcoin (BTC), which has come under pressure due to redemptions from the Grayscale BTC fund.

title: ETH Price: Celsius Moves Massive Ethereum Holdings to Exchange, ETH Price Down 4% - CoinGape
summary: Celsius Network, a bankrupt crypto lender, has been moving a significant portion of its Ethereum holdings to exchanges as part of its recovery plans amid bankruptcy. The company has transferred $35 million worth of Ethereum to Coinbase and another $5.13 million to FalconX in recent transactions. Despite this unstaking of ETH, the combined holdings of two staking wallets associated with Celsius total $1.3 billion in ETH. The move has put pressure on the ETH price, which has dropped 4% to under $2,350 levels. The article suggests that if ETH fails to sustain this support, it could retract to $2,000. The article also mentions that large investors selling their ETH holdings can contribute to the asset's price drop.

title: Ethereum Price Prediction – ETH Price Estimated to Reach $ 2,506.30 By Jan 28, 2024 - CoinCodex
summary:
The article provides a financial news article about Ethereum's price prediction. According to the article, Ethereum's price is expected to reach $2,506.30 by January 28, 2024, which represents an 8.06% increase from the current price. The article also provides technical analysis and indicators for Ethereum, including moving averages, RSI, and momentum indicators.

Overall, the article provides a neutral outlook on Ethereum's price prediction, suggesting that the market is currently neutral and that investors should seek independent professional consultation before making any investment decisions.

title: Is the Local Top In? Ethereum Foundation Adds to ETH Selling Pressure With $1.7M Move - DailyCoin
summary: The Ethereum Foundation has sold $1.7 million worth of Ethereum (ETH) tokens, sparking concerns among the crypto community about a potential price top and dump. The sale was made over four transactions on Monday, with the funds transferred to a "Grant Provider" address. This move has been linked to local market tops in the past, and the recent sell-off has contributed to a broader market correction. The ETH price has dipped by nearly 6% in the past 24 hours, with some experts predicting that Ethereum will outperform Bitcoin in 2024. However, the recent dump has raised concerns about the potential for a pullback to the $2,000 price level if support at $2,388 is not held.

title: Ethereum Coinbase Premium Gap dips after spot ETF approval - AMBCrypto News
summary:
The article discusses the recent development in the Ethereum (ETH) market, specifically the decrease in the Coinbase Premium Gap after the approval of Bitcoin (BTC) spot ETF. The Coinbase Premium Gap is a metric that measures the difference between the price of ETH on Coinbase and Binance, and a positive value indicates that ETH is trading at a premium on Coinbase. According to data from CryptoQuant, the Coinbase Premium Gap has declined by over 450% since the launch of BTC ETF, indicating a shift in sentiment or buying pressure between US-based investors.

Additionally, the article examines the Korean Premium Gap, which measures the price gap between South Korean exchanges and other exchanges. The Korean Premium Gap for ETH has remained positive, indicating strong buying pressure among Korean retail investors. However, the sustained decline in ETH's Premium Gap on Coinbase could increase market volatility.

The article also analyzes the Bollinger Bands (BB) indicator on a daily chart, which shows a steady

title: Ethereum Investors Eye Renewed Surge Amid Cooling-Off Phase: Data - CryptoPotato
summary: Ethereum investors are eyeing a renewed surge in the cryptocurrency's price after it fell below the $2,300 threshold. According to CryptoQuant's analysis, there has been an upward trajectory in funding rates, which signals a bullish sentiment in the market. However, elevated funding rates can also indicate an overheated state in the perpetual markets, potentially foreshadowing a looming long-squeeze event. Despite this, a recent decline in funding rates suggests a cooling-off in the perpetual markets and a potential resurgence in Ethereum's price. This trend could provide an opportunity for the market to stabilize before resuming its upward trajectory.

title: Celsius’ $35M Ethereum Sell-Off Sparks Concerns; Price at Risk of a Crash? - Coinpedia Fintech News
summary: The article discusses the recent actions taken by Celsius Network, a cryptocurrency platform, to address financial challenges. Celsius has been selling a significant amount of Ethereum, totaling over $125 million from January 8 to January 12, according to Arkham Intelligence. This move is part of the platform's commitment to liquidating assets to meet financial obligations and fulfill creditor demands. The sale of Ethereum has led to a 4% dip in the cryptocurrency's value, and analysts are concerned that a breach of the $2,350 threshold could lead to a potential descent to $2,000 or lower. The article also mentions that Celsius still holds a significant Ethereum reserve, valued at approximately $1.3 billion, which complicates the matter further for the platform. Additionally, the article highlights the concept of "whales" in the cryptocurrency market, significant players capable of triggering profit-taking activities, and how this can impact market dips.

summary:
The article discusses the current state of the Ethereum market and whether there is a possibility of a price crash. The author of the article, from Investing Haven, presents several arguments why they believe a price crash is unlikely.

Firstly, the author notes that the Ethereum price chart shows a rising channel, which indicates an uptrend. A price crash would occur in a downtrend, and the channel is currently pointing up.

Secondly, the author mentions that the concept of a "hidden bull market" is a recurring theme in their research service, suggesting that the market may follow a different script than in previous cycles.

Thirdly, the author cites the lack of a secular bearish turning point in their cycle analysis, which suggests that a price crash is unlikely in the short term.

Finally, the author acknowledges that sentiment is negative, and selling makes more sense when prices are dropping. However, they argue that it takes a lot of courage to be contrarian, and they are convinced that there will be no Ethereum price crash in the coming months.

summary:

The sell-off is believed to be due to the downturn that followed the approval of spot Bitcoin ETFs in the US.

The article highlights that while many altcoins and even Bitcoin have crumbled under the weight of post-ETF blues, Ethereum has stood defiant, briefly basking in investor optimism. summary:
The article discusses the current price movement of Bitcoin and Ethereum, with a focus on their potential future trajectories. The main points from the article are:

1. Bitcoin price decline: Bitcoin has seen a notable dip below $40,000, with some analysts predicting a possible further descent to $38,000. This decline has been linked to substantial Bitcoin sales, particularly influenced by the Grayscale GBTC Bitcoin ETF.
2. Ethereum struggles: Ethereum is also grappling with its own bearish momentum, having fallen to $2,347, marking a significant 24-hour drop of nearly 3%.
3. Market sentiment and institutional actions: The decline in Bitcoin's price reflects a complex interplay of factors, including market sentiment, institutional actions, and broader macroeconomic conditions.

title: Coinbase Begins Technical Assessment to Onboard New Ethereum Execution Client for Diversity - Cryptonews
summary: Coinbase, a digital asset exchange, has started a technical assessment to onboard a new Ethereum execution client to increase diversity. The move comes after users complained about the platform's overreliance on Go.Ethereum (Geth) and the risks associated with its dominance. Coinbase revealed that it had been evaluating alternative execution clients and found that Geth was the only client that met its technical requirements for security and scalability. However, the exchange acknowledged that diversity is a critical concern and has taken steps to move away from complete dependence on Geth. Coinbase has announced that it will perform the latest assessments and conclusions towards the next step in this direction, which will be revealed in February.

title: Edward Snowden Urges Support for Jailed Founder of Ethereum Mixer Tornado Cash - Decrypt
summary: Edward Snowden, a whistleblower and international fugitive, has endorsed and backed the legal defense fund for the founder of the popular cryptocurrency mixing service Tornado Cash, Roman Storm. Snowden urged his followers to contribute to the fundraiser to help raise money for Storm's lawyer, who was arrested last year by the U.S. Department of Justice on charges of money laundering. The fundraiser argues that the arrests of Storm and his colleague Alex Pertsev are a direct attack on the open-source development space and may have devastating consequences for developers who write and publish code. Snowden, who is a privacy and cryptocurrency advocate, has long been critical of the sanctioning of Tornado Cash, calling it "deeply illiberal and profoundly authoritarian." He has also created the privacy coin Zcash and spoken about the importance of using cryptocurrencies rather than buying them as an investment.

title: Ethereum Dencun Upgrade to Affect ETH Price, Analysts Say - TOKENPOST
summary: The upcoming Dencun upgrade of the Ethereum network may have an impact on the supply of Ether, according to Luke Nolan, a research associate specializing in Ethereum at CoinShares. The upgrade introduces a new mechanism called blobspace, which can reduce gas usage and decrease the amount of Ether burned during transactions. This could potentially stabilize gas prices at lower levels, leading to less Ether being burned. However, Nolan emphasized that the deflation mechanism on Ethereum is driven by Layer 1 demand, and the Dencun upgrade aims to increase activity on the network by attracting users with lower fees. The upgrade is currently being tested on testnets, with mainnet activation expected in March at the earliest.

title: Ethereum Futures Market Cool Off Sets Stage For ETH To Rally: Quant - NewsBTC
summary: The article discusses the recent cooling down of the Ethereum futures market and how it could potentially set the stage for a price rise in ETH. An analyst from CryptoQuant explains that the decline in ETH funding rates, which refers to the periodic fees that futures contract holders exchange with each other, suggests that there may be a shift in sentiment from bullish to neutral or even bearish. This could reduce the risk of a long squeeze event, which could potentially lead to a price increase. The analyst notes that while the funding rates are still positive, their magnitude may no longer be associated with an overheated market. The article also provides a brief overview of ETH's price movement, which has declined by around 5% over the past week.

title: Celsius Dump Triggers Ethereum Dive: $35 Million Sell-Off Sends ETH Price Crashing - NewsBTC
summary: Celsius Network, a cryptocurrency lending platform, has been selling off its Ethereum (ETH) holdings to pay off creditors as part of its ongoing bankruptcy proceedings. According to on-chain analysts, Celsius has sold over $125 million worth of ETH in the past week, with a total valuation of approximately $1.3 billion still held by the company. The sale of ETH has triggered a 4% decline in the price of ETH, with analysts predicting a potential retreat towards the $2,000 mark if the price fails to hold above the current demand zone. Wealthy investors have also been identified as a contributing factor in the recent price decline, as their significant transactions often trigger profit-taking activities among regular ETH holders. Despite the current market dynamics, the article notes that the scrutiny on Celsius' Ethereum transactions will persist as the bankruptcy drama unfolds, with investors and observers closely monitoring the situation for further developments and anticipating the broader implications for both Celsius and the crypto ecosystem.
